newsitem.title: JAPAN: PeopleSoft to spend $120 mln on development in '97. [CORRECTED 10:58 GMT]
newsitem.headline: PeopleSoft to spend $120 mln on development in '97. [CORRECTED 10:58 GMT]

text.p: U.S. software house PeopleSoft Inc said on Tuesday that it will spend $120 million on product development worldwide this calendar year.
Company president Dave Duffield told a news conference in Tokyo that a large amount of the money would be spent for the development of software for management applications in the Japanese market.

Norikazu Tokusue, president of PeopleSoft Japan K.K., a wholly-owned subsidiary of PeopleSoft which started operations last September, said the firm would start official shipments of the Japanese version of its application series "PeopleSoft 6" on May 22.
PeopleSoft said in a statement that it would continue to localise its other management software for the Japanese market which have already been released in other parts of the world.
Tokusue said that the company expects its annual sales to total 14 billion to 15 billion yen by calendar 2000.

"The Japanese market has enormous potential," Duffield said. "It took us a while to localise (the product), now the core applications are done and we are confident we will gain considerable momentum."
